channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 2 Abandoned bikes, 19th July
item.description:
Two selfish Moran using forest bikes have abandoned them in the middle of a pedestrian area rather than literally across the traffic lights from where they are in a designated bay get rid of them

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Sumner Street, Southwark, London

item.title: Blocked drain, 19th July
item.description:

item.title: Tree growing out of control its the worst on the street, need pruning, 19th July
item.description:

item.title: Overhanging and needs priming, 19th July
item.description:
This tree annually causes problems for the residents. The tree has significant overgrowth extending beyond the property boundary and is currently full of ripe fruit that is beginning to drop. This is creating a mess and presents a potential safety and slip hazard for pedestrians and residents.Could you please assess the situation and carry out maintenance as needed?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Road, Widmore, London

item.title: Possible flooding, 19th July
item.description:
This is a suggestion. We have lived in Welling since 1975. In that time we have seen most of the front gardens cemented over or bricked over. This prevents rain water from being absorbed into the ground and overloads the road drains. Please consider a small reduction in Council Tax for residents who keep their gardens, making for better air quality, good mental heath and good drainage, which helps the drain systems. It may also see an uplift in brown bin usage, which is revenue for the Council. I realise this will amuse you but Welling is fast becoming a concrete jungle, the charm has all but disappeared.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charmouth Road, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
